docs.text: Class: ConditionAssertion Study Meta Data URI: anvil:ConditionAssertion Parents is_a: Thing - Highest Level Class Attributes Own condition_code 0..* Description: Condition Code should be from one of a recognized ontology. Multiple codes can be indicated, but should simply be alternative encodings for the same entity such as alternates encodings from other ontologies. Recommended ontologies include: SNOMED_CT, HP, OMIM and ORPHA and coded with the corresponding curies SNOMED : https://bioregistry.io/registry/snomedct HP : https://bioregistry.io/registry/hp OMIM : https://bioregistry.io/registry/omim ORPHA : https://bioregistry.io/registry/orphanet Range: EnumConditionCode condition_source_value 1..1 Description: Original Source Value for condition Range: String condition_assertion 0..1 Description: Condition Assertion Range: EnumConditionAssertion condition_type 1..1 Description: Does this condition represent a specific "type" of condition, such as "Phenotypic Feature" vs "Disease" in a rare disease setting. Range: EnumConditionType age_at_assertion 0..1 Description: The age at which this condition is being asserted. Range: Integer age_at_onset 0..1 Description: The age of onset for this condition. Range: Integer age_at_resolution 0..1 Description: The age at which this condition was resolved, abated or cured. Should be left empty in cases of current active status. Range: Integer Inherited from Thing: id 1..1 Description: ID associated with a class Range: String

docs.text: anvil-schema metamodel version: 1.7.0 version: None Classes Thing - Highest Level Class AccessControlledRecord - Element for which specific access control restrictions apply. Subject - This entity is the subject about which data or references are recorded. | This includes the idea of a human participant in a study, a cell line, an animal model, | or any other similar entity. Participant - Basic participant demographics SubjectAssertion - Assertion about a particular Subject. May include Conditions, Measurements, etc. AccessPolicy - Describes the access required for a given element of data. Aliquot - Represent exact tubes or total amounts available of a Sample. BiospecimenCollection - Biospecimen Collection Family - Family FamilyMember - Family Measurement - Measurements Procedure - Procedures Sample - Biospecimen data Study - Study Meta Data Mixins Slots access_policy_code - Access Policy Code age_at_assertion - The age at which this condition is being asserted. age_at_collection - The age at which this biospecimen was collected. age_at_event - Age of participant when procedure was performed/recorded age_at_last_vital_status - Age at Last Vital Status age_at_observation - Age of participant when measurement was taken/recorded age_at_onset - The age of onset for this condition. age_at_resolution - The age at which this condition was resolved, abated or cured. Should be left empty in cases of current active status. availablity_status - Can this Sample be requested for further analysis? biospecimen_collection_id_fk - ID associated with the Biospecimen Collection event. condition_assertion - Condition Assertion condition_source_value - Original Source Value for condition consanguinity - Is there known or suspected consanguinity in this study family? data_access_type - Data Access Type date_of_birth - Date at which the individual was born. May be impacted by privacy rules described in date_of_birth_type. date_of_birth_type - Privacy rule modification applied to date_of_birth. description - Description disease_limitation - Disease Use Limitations ethnicity - Classification categories of human, taken from NIH, based on the social group a person belongs to, and either identifies with or is identified with by others, as a result of a complex of cultural, biological, geographical and other factors such as linguistic, dietary and religion traditions; ancestry, background, allegiance, or association; and physical characteristics traditionally associated with race. ethnicity_source_value - Ethnicity value as reported in the original source external_id - Other identifiers for this entity, eg, from the submitting study or in systems link dbGaP external_study_id - External Study ID family_description - Free title describing the study family, such as potential inheritance or details about consanguinity family_external_id - Other study specific study identifiers family_id_fk - Family Identifier family_member_id - Family Member ID indicating presence in the family family_study_focus - What is this study family investigating? EG, a specific condition. The code should be prefixed with a recognizable curie. family_type - Describes the 'type' of study family, eg, trio. funding_source - Funding Source has_access_policy - Which access policy applies to this element? has_assertion - Which assertions are made about this Subject? has_sample - Which samples were collected or processed for this Subject? id - ID associated with a class in_study - With which study is this class associated? laterality - Laterality information for the site measurement_code - Measurement code should be from a recognized ontology preceded by a recognized curie. Multiple entries should reflect alternate codes for the same measurement. measurement_source_value - Original measurement text measurement_unit - UCUM Unit associated with the field measurement_value_code - Code indicating measurement value such as positive, negative, etc. method - The approach used to collect the biospecimen. organism_type - Organism Type Label other_family_member_id - Other member of the same family to which there is a relationship being described parent_sample_id - Parent Sample ID parent_study_id - Parent Study ID phenotypic_sex - Sex of the Participant phenotypic_sex_source_value - Original source value for phenotypic sex value principal_investigator - Principal Investigator procedure_code - Procedure code should be from a recognized ontology preceded by a recognized curie. Multiple entries should reflect alternate codes for the same procedure. procedure_source_value - Original procedure text processing - Curied code associated processing that was applied to the Parent Sample or from the Biospecimen Collection that yielded this distinct sample quantity - The total quantity of the specimen race - Reported race defined by NIH Racial and Ethnic Categories and Definitions (NOT-OD-15-089) race_source_value - Race value as observed from the original source text relationship_code - Relationship of the "Family Member" to the "Other Family Member" (i.e. mother, father, etc). This is required if other_family_member_id is present. Code must be from the HL7 FamilyMember ValueSet sample_availability_status - Can this Sample be requested for further analysis sample_concentration - What is the concentration of the analyte in the Aliquot? sample_concentration_unit - Units associated with the concentration of the analyte in the Aliquot? UCUM coding preferred (with curie, UCUM) sample_id_fk - Sample ID the aliquot is associated with sample_type - Curied code associated the type of material of which this Sample is comprised sample_volume - What is the volume of the Aliquot? sample_volume_unit - Units associated with the volume? UCUM coding preferred (with curie, UCUM) site - The location of the specimen collection. spatial_qualifier - Any spatial/location qualifiers storage_method - Curied code indicating how is the Sample stored, eg, Frozen or with additives study_title - Study Title ➞age_at_assertion - The age in decimal years of the Subject when the assertion was made. ➞age_at_event - The age in decimal years of the Subject at the time point which the assertion describes, | eg, age of onset or when a measurement was performed. ➞age_at_resolution - The age in decimal years of the Subject when the asserted state was resolved. ➞assertion_type - The semantic type of the resource, eg, Condition. ➞code - The structured term defining the meaning of the assertion. ➞display - The friendly display string of the coded term ➞source_code - The structured term defining the meaning of the assertion as provided by the source. ➞source_display - The friendly display string of the coded term as provided by the source. ➞value_code - The structured term defining the value of the assertion. ➞value_display - The friendly display string of the coded term for the value of the assertion. ➞value_number - The numeric value of the assertion. ➞value_units - The structured term defining the units of the value. subject_type - Type of entity this record represents vital_status - Vital Status website - Website Enums EnumAccessCode - Type of research use case allowed EnumAccessType - Type of access controls applied EnumAssertionType - Provides options to describe the expressed semantics of a condition. EnumAvailabilityStatus - Is the Thing available for use? EnumConditionAssertion - Enumerations for Condition Assertion EnumConditionCode - Recommended ontologies include: SNOMED_CT, HP, OMIM and ORPHA, prefixed with those curies EnumConsanguinityAssertion - Asserts known or suspected consanguinity in this study family EnumDateOfBirthType - Privacy rules that may modify a date value. EnumEthnicity - OMB Codes describing Hispanic or Latino ethnicity. EnumFamilyType - Enumerations describing research family type EnumLaterality - Laterality information for the site EnumMeasurementValueCode - Indicate measurement details such as positive/negative/indeterminate EnumRace - OMB Codes describing race. EnumSampleCollectionMethod - The approach used to collect the biospecimen. Recommend ontology: LOINC . EnumSex - Terms describing an individual's sex. EnumSite - The location of the specimen collection. Recommended ontology: SNOMED Body Site EnumSpatialQualifiers - Any spatial/location qualifiers. EnumSubjectType - Types of entities EnumVitalStatus - Is the entity living? docs.title: About

docs.text: metamodel version: 1.7.0 version: None
docs.title: anvil-schema

docs.text: Thing - Highest Level Class AccessControlledRecord - Element for which specific access control restrictions apply. Subject - This entity is the subject about which data or references are recorded. | This includes the idea of a human participant in a study, a cell line, an animal model, | or any other similar entity. Participant - Basic participant demographics SubjectAssertion - Assertion about a particular Subject. May include Conditions, Measurements, etc. AccessPolicy - Describes the access required for a given element of data. Aliquot - Represent exact tubes or total amounts available of a Sample. BiospecimenCollection - Biospecimen Collection Family - Family FamilyMember - Family Measurement - Measurements Procedure - Procedures Sample - Biospecimen data Study - Study Meta Data
docs.title: Classes

docs.text: access_policy_code - Access Policy Code age_at_assertion - The age at which this condition is being asserted. age_at_collection - The age at which this biospecimen was collected. age_at_event - Age of participant when procedure was performed/recorded age_at_last_vital_status - Age at Last Vital Status age_at_observation - Age of participant when measurement was taken/recorded age_at_onset - The age of onset for this condition. age_at_resolution - The age at which this condition was resolved, abated or cured. Should be left empty in cases of current active status. availablity_status - Can this Sample be requested for further analysis? biospecimen_collection_id_fk - ID associated with the Biospecimen Collection event. condition_assertion - Condition Assertion condition_source_value - Original Source Value for condition consanguinity - Is there known or suspected consanguinity in this study family? data_access_type - Data Access Type date_of_birth - Date at which the individual was born. May be impacted by privacy rules described in date_of_birth_type. date_of_birth_type - Privacy rule modification applied to date_of_birth. description - Description disease_limitation - Disease Use Limitations ethnicity - Classification categories of human, taken from NIH, based on the social group a person belongs to, and either identifies with or is identified with by others, as a result of a complex of cultural, biological, geographical and other factors such as linguistic, dietary and religion traditions; ancestry, background, allegiance, or association; and physical characteristics traditionally associated with race. ethnicity_source_value - Ethnicity value as reported in the original source external_id - Other identifiers for this entity, eg, from the submitting study or in systems link dbGaP external_study_id - External Study ID family_description - Free title describing the study family, such as potential inheritance or details about consanguinity family_external_id - Other study specific study identifiers family_id_fk - Family Identifier family_member_id - Family Member ID indicating presence in the family family_study_focus - What is this study family investigating? EG, a specific condition. The code should be prefixed with a recognizable curie. family_type - Describes the 'type' of study family, eg, trio. funding_source - Funding Source has_access_policy - Which access policy applies to this element? has_assertion - Which assertions are made about this Subject? has_sample - Which samples were collected or processed for this Subject? id - ID associated with a class in_study - With which study is this class associated? laterality - Laterality information for the site measurement_code - Measurement code should be from a recognized ontology preceded by a recognized curie. Multiple entries should reflect alternate codes for the same measurement. measurement_source_value - Original measurement text measurement_unit - UCUM Unit associated with the field measurement_value_code - Code indicating measurement value such as positive, negative, etc. method - The approach used to collect the biospecimen. organism_type - Organism Type Label other_family_member_id - Other member of the same family to which there is a relationship being described parent_sample_id - Parent Sample ID parent_study_id - Parent Study ID phenotypic_sex - Sex of the Participant phenotypic_sex_source_value - Original source value for phenotypic sex value principal_investigator - Principal Investigator procedure_code - Procedure code should be from a recognized ontology preceded by a recognized curie. Multiple entries should reflect alternate codes for the same procedure. procedure_source_value - Original procedure text processing - Curied code associated processing that was applied to the Parent Sample or from the Biospecimen Collection that yielded this distinct sample quantity - The total quantity of the specimen race - Reported race defined by NIH Racial and Ethnic Categories and Definitions (NOT-OD-15-089) race_source_value - Race value as observed from the original source text relationship_code - Relationship of the "Family Member" to the "Other Family Member" (i.e. mother, father, etc). This is required if other_family_member_id is present. Code must be from the HL7 FamilyMember ValueSet sample_availability_status - Can this Sample be requested for further analysis sample_concentration - What is the concentration of the analyte in the Aliquot? sample_concentration_unit - Units associated with the concentration of the analyte in the Aliquot? UCUM coding preferred (with curie, UCUM) sample_id_fk - Sample ID the aliquot is associated with sample_type - Curied code associated the type of material of which this Sample is comprised sample_volume - What is the volume of the Aliquot? sample_volume_unit - Units associated with the volume? UCUM coding preferred (with curie, UCUM) site - The location of the specimen collection. spatial_qualifier - Any spatial/location qualifiers storage_method - Curied code indicating how is the Sample stored, eg, Frozen or with additives study_title - Study Title ➞age_at_assertion - The age in decimal years of the Subject when the assertion was made. ➞age_at_event - The age in decimal years of the Subject at the time point which the assertion describes, | eg, age of onset or when a measurement was performed. ➞age_at_resolution - The age in decimal years of the Subject when the asserted state was resolved. ➞assertion_type - The semantic type of the resource, eg, Condition. ➞code - The structured term defining the meaning of the assertion. ➞display - The friendly display string of the coded term ➞source_code - The structured term defining the meaning of the assertion as provided by the source. ➞source_display - The friendly display string of the coded term as provided by the source. ➞value_code - The structured term defining the value of the assertion. ➞value_display - The friendly display string of the coded term for the value of the assertion. ➞value_number - The numeric value of the assertion. ➞value_units - The structured term defining the units of the value. subject_type - Type of entity this record represents vital_status - Vital Status website - Website
